snippet: Since the late 1990s, when they first rented from a retired teacher, four caddies have spent every Masters week ensconced in a 68-year-old house in Augusta.
abstract: Golf caddies Ken Comboy, J P Fitzgerald, Cayce Kerr and Billy Foster have spent every Masters week in an Augusta rental home since the late 1990s, when they first rented from retired teacher and patron of the arts Joyce Culpepper; she died in 2010 but stipulated in her will that the house is to be made available to the four caddies ever year during the Masters for as long as they wish to stay there.
lead_paragraph: Since the late 1990s, when they first rented from a retired teacher, four caddies have spent every Masters week ensconced in a 68-year-old house in Augusta.

headline.seo: Caddies Forge Masters Tradition at Augusta Home Rental
headline.main: A Bagful of Memories of a Home in Augusta
headline.print_headline: A Bagful of Memories of a Home in Augusta
